titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Evgenii Miller Papers, 1916-1924
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California

did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 20 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 1 album box, 17 envelopes

did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, orders, printed matter, and photographs, relating to White Russian military and diplomatic activities during the Russian Civil War, Bolshevik atrocities, and White Russian refugees

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Evgenii Miller Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1928.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Graduated, Nikolaevskoe Kavaleriiskoe Uchilishche, St. Petersburg. Assigned to Leib-gvardii Gusarskii Polk, TSarskoe Selo
Russian Military Agent in Belgium, Holland and Italy
Chief-of-Staff of the Moscow Military Region
Chief-of-Staff of the Russian Fifth Army and Commander of the Twenty-Sixth Army Corps Promoted to Lieutenant-General Arrested and wounded by rebel soldiers during Revolution
Placed in charge of demobilizing Russian troops on the Western Front by Russian Ambassador to France Vasilii Maklakov
Appointed Governor-General of Arkhangel'sk Region by Nikolai CHaikovskii and Commander-in-Chief of anti-Bolshevik Northern Armies by Admiral V. Kolchak
Military and Naval Representative of Gen. Petr Vrangel' in Paris
Commander of the First Section of the Russkii Obshche-Voinskii Soiuz (R.O.V.S). After the kidnapping of Lieut.-Gen. Aleksandr Kutepov by the O.G.P.U, assumed chairmanship of whole organization
Kidnapped by Soviet agents on the streets of Paris. Taken to Moscow, condemned to death and shot on orders of the N.K.V.D.

scopecontent.p: Testimony of Lieut.-Gen. Evgenii Miller given to Gen. Lavr Kornilov's Commission and report to French ambassador and foreign press re situation in Russia.

Papers belonging to the office of the Voennyi Agent vo Frantsii, Lieut.-Gen. Evgenii Miller. Includes material related to Russkii Ekspeditsionnyi Korpus vo Frantsii; administrative matters; correspondence with Russian Military Agents in other countries and Russian Army General Headquarters; intelligence and other reports about the Soviet Union and European countries in which refugees resided; material related to Russian refugees, especially military, including problems of their legal status abroad, employment, transportation, material support, medical aid and education. Lieut.-Gen. Nikolai Golovin's original arrangement of the collection into files has been retained. However, material within each file has been described in greater detail and arranged within each file, either by subject or physical form.

71 prints and 7 glass negatives. Includes photographs collected as evidence by the Osobaia Komissiia po razsledovaniiu zlodeianii bol'shevikov, sostoiashchei pri Glavnokomanduiushchem Vooruzhennymi Silami na IUge Rossii depicting Bolshevik atrocities committed during the Civil War and photographs of Russian Army officers abroad. Arranged by subject.

did.unittitle: WRITINGS, 1917-1924. See also SUBJECT FILE/Group I, File 38M

"Pokazaniia Gen.-Leitenanta E. K. Millera, K.-ra 26 arm. Korpusa, dannyia im Sledstvennoi Komissii 20-28 aprelia 1917 goda, naznachennoi Glavnokomanduiushchim Petr. V. Okruga Generalom Kornilovym, po prikazaniiu Voennago Ministra Guchkova"
Russkii Legion vo Frantsii. Day-orders. Hand-written and mimeograph
Tylovoe Upravlenie Russkikh voisk vo Frantsii. Day-orders, 1917 August-1918 February. Mimeograph
Russkie Voiska vo Frantsii. Day-orders, 1917 September-November. Mimeograph
Vtoraia Osobaia pekhotnaia diviziia. Day-orders, 1918 January-March. Typescript

Komitet po obezpecheniiu vysshago obrazovaniia russkomu iunoshestvu. Correspondence of Lieut.-Gen. Ivan KHolmnsen and Lieut.-Gen. Evgenii Miller with Mikhail Fedorov re placement of former military personnel in institutions of higher learning, 1922 January-1923 November. Typescript and handwritten
Russkii Natsional'nyi Komitet v Parizhe. Minutes of meetings, 1923 January-December. Typescript and handwritten
Finland. Reports and excerpts from newspapers, 1920. Typescript
Kronstadt Rebellion, 1921. Includes reports, telegrams, proclamations and radio messages of rebels. Typescript

Severo-Zapadnaia Armiia of Lieut.-Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Includes correspondence of Lieut-Gens. Evgenii Miller, Nikolai Monkevich, Nikolai Kliuev and Col. Dimitrii Kandaurov; reports and printed matter re conditions of internment in Finland, Estonia and Latvia; evacuation of army to the Balkans and the Crimea. Typescript and handwritten
Correspondence between Lieut.-Gen. Andrei Rodzianko and Lieut.-Gen. Evgenii Miller, 1921
Makhrov, Petr Lieut.-Gen., "Voennyi obzor za Noiabr' 1920". Typescript
Poland. Rossiiskaia Voennaia Missiia v Pol'she. Material related to the formation of the Russian Third Army, 1919 March-1920 December. Typescript and handwritten

Correspondence of and about Gens. Bredov, Balakhovich, Glazenap and Boboshko; Russian Military Representative in Paris Lieut.-Gen. Evgenii Miller, Russian Military Representative in Poland, Gen. Petr Makhrov and Russian Military Representatives Generals Gerua, KHolmnsen and Pototskii; diplomatic representative Girs and Foreign Minister Petr Struve; V.S.IU.R. headquarters and Gen. Petr Vrangel'; negotiations with Polish government and Boris Savinkov re alliance with Petliura and united military front against the Bolsheviks; effect of separate peace between Ukraine and Bolsheviks; contacts with French military and government agencies
Reports. Mostly intelligence reports re condition and movements of armies in Finland, the Baltics, Poland and the Ukraine
Poland. Rossiiskaia Voennaia Missiia v Pol'she, 1921 January-March
Belukha-Kokhanovskii, Deitrikh Capt. Report to Chief-of-Staff of Russian Army re Third Army. Typescript
Correspondence. Includes correspondence of Gen. Petr Makhrov
Russkii politicheskii evakutsionnyi Komitet. Correspondence. Typescript
Sovet po delam internirovannykh v Pol'she
Maps. Disposition of Polish, White Russian and Bolshevik troops on western front, 1921 March
Poland. Rossiiskaia Voennaia Missiia v Pol'she, 1921 April-December
Makhrov, Petr Lieut.-Gen. and Lieut.-Gen. Pavel SHatilov,V.S.I.U.R. General Staff. Typescript and handwritten
Makhrov, Petr Lieut.-Gen. Typescript and handwritten
Lists of personnel receiving aid, Third Russian Army and "Diviziia Smerti" Narodno-Dobrovol'cheskaia Armiia. Typescript
Orders. Russkii politicheskii evakutsionnyi Komitet. Mimeograph
Press. Summaries of Belorussian and Polish press. Typescript
Poland. Rossiiskaia Voennaia Missiia v Pol'she, 1921 December-1923 September
Correspondence of Lieut.-Gen. Petr Makhrov. Typescript and handwritten
Obshchestvo pomoshchi russkim bezhentsam v Pol'she (M.K.K.)
Reports. Includes material re internment camps (Tukhol' and others) for Russian military and civilian refugees in Poland. Typescipt
Switzerland. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v SHveitsarii, 1919 January-October

Correspondence and reports of Major-Gen. Sergei Golovan (Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v SHveitsarii) to Lieut.-Gen. Nikolai Golovin (Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent vo Frantsii) and Lieut.-Gen. Dmitrii SHcherbachev (Shtab). Includes material re Bolshevik activity in Switzerland and Germany; Turkish contacts with Muslim territories of former Russian Empire; political and military situation in the Ukraine, the Baltic States and Poland. Also includes press summaries and clippings
Switzerland. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v SHveitsarii, 1919 October-1920 February. Same as above
Switzerland. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v SHveitsarii, 1920 June-December
Correspondence re personnel matters. Includes material re transfer of officers to Crimea and aid to invalid officers and their families. Typescript and handwritten
Italy. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Italii, 1920 March-1921 December

Correspondence of Col. Prince Aleksandr Volkonskii and Capt. Den' (Rossiiskie Voennye Agenty v Italii) re personnel, financial and office matters. Includes material re transfer of Russian military personnel to Crimea. Typescript and handwritten
Reports of Col. Prince Aleksandr Volkonskii. Includes reports re political situation in Italy. Typescript
Greece. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Gretsii, 1921 April-June
Correspondence, reports and press summaries of Col. Poliakov (Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Gretsii) re situation of Russian military and civilian refugees in Greece. Typescript and handwritten
Reports. Stratigos, X., Expose general de lasituation militaire and La campagned'Asie-Mineure, 1921. Printed copies
Denmark. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Danii, 1919 June-1921 December

Correspondence of Maj.-Gen. Sergei Pototskii (Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Danii) and Col. Aleksei von Lampe re personnel, financial and office matters. Includes material re transfer of Russian military personnel to Crimea. Typescript and handwritten
Reports of Maj.-Gen. Sergei Pototskii and Col. Aleksei von Lampe. Includes material re political situation and Bolshevik activity in Scandinavia, the Baltic States and Germany. Typescript
Czechoslovakia. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v CHekhoslovakii, 1920 May-June 1922 June

Correspondence of Major-Gen. M. Leontiev (Voennyi Agent v CHekhoslovakii). Includes office correspondence and material related to condition and political status of Russian military and civilian refugees; transfer of Russian military personnel to Crimea; repatriation of inmates in prisoner of war camps to the Soviet Union; situation of Cossacks. Typescript and handwritten
Reports. Includes material re activity of Bolsheviks in Czechoslovakia; status of Russian refugees; summaries and clippings of Czech press. Typescript
Great Britain. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Velikobritanii, 1920 Jan.-1923 Nov.

General office correspondence of Maj.-Gen. Boris Gartman, (Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Velikobritanii) especially re financial matters. Also includes material re transfer of Russian military personnel to Crimea and miscellaneous matters re situation of Russian officers and their families in Great Britain. Typescript and handwritten
Status of naval property from Arkhangel'sk campaign. Typescript
Reports. Includes material re political situation in Great Britain and Bolshevik activity in Germany. Typescript
Germany. Nachal'nik Delegatsii po delam russkikh voennoplennykh i bezhentsev v Germanii, 1920-1921

Correspondence of Maj.-Gen. Ivan KHolmnsen re situation of Russian military refugees from Poland (Gen. Bredov's Army); Red Army prisoners interned in Germany, activity of Soviet Representative Viktor Kopp and problem of repatriation to the Soviet Union; transfer of officers from Armies of the Northwest to Crimea, negotiations for transit visas and financial support. Typescript and handwritten
Reports re political situation in Germany. Typescript
United States. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Soedinennykh SHtatakh Ameriki, 1920-1921

Correspondence of Col. Aleksandr Nikolaev. Includes general office correspondence; material related to purchase of war supplies and matters concerning Russian officers in the United States. Typescript and handwritten
Report re political situation in the United States. Typescript
Japan. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v IAponii, 1920 Sept.- 1921 Dec.
Podtiagin, Mikhail, Maj.-Gen., (Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v IAponii)

Correspondence. Includes general office correspondence; information re government monies in possession of Ataman Semenov; military personnel matters, including KHabarovskii and Sibirskii Kadetskii Korpus. Typescript and handwritten
Press summaries from Japanese press related to Russian matters. Typescript
Reports re situation in the Far East, Siberia and Japan. Typescript
General. Includes appeals and oaths of allegiance to Ataman Semenov of various cossack and peasant groups; protocols of meetings of the Amur Cossack Army; military orders of Ataman Semenov
Correspondence of his office in Tokyo. Typescript
"K narodam Rossii i k russkim liudiam", Dec. 1920

Reports re Amur region, Siberia, Republic of the Far East (Dal'ne-Vostochnaia Respublika), Transbaikal region; intelligence operations; situation of White Movement in the Far East; speech of V. Ivanov at Conference of non-Socialist organizations in Vladivostok (S"ezd nesotsialisticheskikh organizatsii). Typescript
Romania. Voennyi Predstavitel' v Rumynii Glavnokomanduiushchago V.S.IU.R., 1921 Jan.-Dec. 1923 Dec.
Correspondence of Lieut.-Gen. Aleksandr Gerua. Typescript and handwritten
Reports. Includes information re situation in the Soviet Union. Typescript
Serbia. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Korolevstve Serbov, KHorvatov i Sloventsev and Rossiiskii Poslannik v Korolevstve Serbov, KHorvatov i Sloventsev, 1920 Aug.-1923 Dec.

Correspondence of Vasilii SHtrandtman and Maj.-Gen. Dmitrii Pototskii. Includes general office correspondence; negotiations for transit visas to the Crimea for officers of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich's army; establishment of camps and search for employment for military refugees; condition of Military School in Sarajevo; Red Cross aid to refugees. Typescript and handwritten
General. Includes material re transit of officers from army of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich and supply of refugees by Red Cross
List of Russian military regalia brought to Serbia by Col. Kolobov
Sweden and Norway. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v SHvetsii i Norvegii, 1920-1921
General. Treaty between Estonia and Lieut.-Gen. P. Glazenap on behalf of Severo-Zapadnaia Armiia, 1920 Feb. Typescript copy

General. Includes general office correspondence of Col. Dmitrii Kandaurov. Also includes material re condition of military refugees from Severo-Zapadnaia Armiia of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich in Finland and the Baltic; exploitation of Russian prisoners of war in Estonian camps; negotiations for transit visas for transfer of Russian officers to the Crimea; questions re military supplies of Severo-Zapadnaia Armiia. Typescript and handwritten
IUdenich, Nikolai Lieut.-Gen. Typescript and handwritten
Press. Summaries and clippings from European press. Typescript and printed matter
Evseev, I., "Zapiska o polozhenii rabochikh na lesnykh rabotakh", 1920. Typescript
"Postanovlenie", Osobaia Komissiia po revizii tylovykh uchrezhdenii...Severo-Zapadnoi Armii, 1920. Typescript

Diplomatic. Includes transcripts of telegrams and other correspondence between Boris Bakhmetev, Nikolai de Basili, Mikhail Girs, Gorlov, Lieut.-Gen. Evgenii Hermonius, V. Krupenskii, Vasilii Maklakov, Anatolii Neratov, Vasilii SHtrandtman and Petr Struve. Typescript and handwritten
Repatriation and resettlement of Russian troops. Includes correspondence with Gen. Pelle
Supplies for Vrangel's Army in the Crimea. Includes munitions and medical supplies
Bulgaria. Voennyi Predstavitel' v Bolgarii, Nachal'nik Snabzheniia Russkoi Armii and Rossiiskaia Missiia v Bolgarii, 1923 Nov.- 1924 Sept.

Correspondence, especially related to situation of Russian military and civilian refugees. Includes material of Komitet po delam russkikh bezhentsev v Bolgarii and Russkaia Stroitel'naia Kontora. Typescript and handwritten
Dobrinovich, (?), "Doklad gospodinu Ministru Vnutrennikh Del i Narodnago Zdraviia". Typescript
Bulgaria. Voennyi Predstavitel' v Bolgarii, Nachal'nik Snabzheniia Russkoi Armii and Rossiiskaia Missiia v Bolgarii, 1921-1924

Correspondence of Lieut.-Gen. Evgenii Viazmitinov, (Voennyi Predstavitel' v Bolgarii), A. Petriaev, (Rossiiskaia Missiia v Bolgarii) and Lieut-Gen. Petr Stavitski, (Nachal'nik Snabzheniia Russkoi Armii). Also includes correspondence of Mikhail Girs, Lieut.-Gen. Ivan KHolmnsen, Maj.-Gen. Pavel Kusonskii, Lieut.-Gen. Ivan Ronzhin, Boris Serafimov, Lieut.-Gen. Pavel SHatilov and Gen. Weygand related to the resettlement of Russian military contingents in Bulgaria and their financial support. Includes material of Komitet po delam russkikh bezhentsev v Bolgarii and the Red Cross. Typescript and handwritten
Printed matter. Rus', 1923 June 10. Printed copy
Nachal'nik informatsionnago otdeleniia shtaba, "Znachenie ukrainskago voprosa dlia nastoiiashchago momenta", July 1921
Vitkovskii, Lieut.-Gen., "Svodka ob obstanovke v mestakh raspolozheniia russkikh garnizonov i rabochikh partii"
Rossiiskoe Obshchestvo Krasnago Kresta and other humanitarian organizations, 1921-1924
General. Individual charity cases. Includes requests for aid and inquiries re individuals
Komitet o Pomoshchi Tuberkuleznym. Appeal. Typescript
Statement of purpose and organizational matters. Typescript
Russkie Gumanitarnye Organizatsii v Parizhe. Minutes of meeting. Typescript
Soveshchanie po Delam o Bezhentsakh. Correspondence and minutes of meetings. Includes correspondence of Mikhail Girs and material related to League of Nations
General. Includes Nikolai Astrov, Lieut.-Gen. Nikolai Baratov, Boris Ivanitskii, Lieut.-Gen. Ivan KHolmnsen. Also Soiuz Russkikh Invalidov za Granitsei and Zemsko-Gorodskoi Komitet
Individual charity cases. Includes requests for aid and inquiries re individuals
Refugees in Marseille under care of Red Cross and repatriation of former Russian prisoners of war by French government
Correspondence re aid to Russian war invalids in exile. Includes material re officers of Sever-Zapadnaia Armiia in Estonia
General. Miscellaneous material re relief of St. Petersburg
British Committe of the Russian Red Cross Fund in Great Britain, First Report 1919-1921

unittitle.title: Apercu de la situation de la Croix Rouge
Russe a la fin de l'annee 1921
Otchet o deiatel'nosti Glavnago Upravleniia i
mestnykh Predstavitel'stv za granitsei, po
1-e iiulia 1922
Les refugies russes dans la region de
Constantinople au mois de juin 1921

did.unittitle: "Otchet o deiatel'nosti Glavnago Upravleniia R.O.K.K. za vremia s 1-go marta po 1-oe noiabria 1921 goda". Typescript
"Zagranichnaia pomoshch golodaiushchim v Rossii". Also includes open letter of Mezhdunarodnaia kommissiia pomoshchi golodaiushchim to Soviet Foreign Minister Georgii CHicherin. Typescript

France. Ministere de la Guerre, 1921-1923. Correspondence of Gen. SHCHerbatchev, Lieut.-Gen. Ivan Miller and others with Gens. Desticker and Weygand and the Ministere de Guerre, the Etat Majeur de l'Armee, Bureau Slave and the Comite Militaire Allie de Versailles

General office correspondence. Includes situation of Russian officers in France and repatriation of military personnel who had served on Western Front; Russian officers in transit from the Baltic and other fronts, closing of Russian Military Mission in Peking. Typescript

Individual cases involving former Russian officers. Includes questions related to documentation, the education of Russian officers in French military schools and enquiries re missing persons. Typescript and handwritten

Military situation of anti-Bolshevik forces on the Polish Front and the Crimea. Includes telegrams, transcripts of telegrams and bulletins re situation on Crimean front; negotiations for aid from French government; transportation of supplies and personnel. Typescript
Soviet Union. Miscellaneous material re purchase of supplies. Typescript
Comite Parlementaire Russe a Paris to French president. Typescript
Vrangel', Petr Gen. et al., "Aux Peuples de l'Univers!". Typescript
Correspondence. Includes letters of Gens. Foch and Weygand
General office correspondence. Includes material re situation of Russian military personnel in France; repatriation of Russian military personnel (Kabadzha Camp). Typescript and handwritten

Individual cases. Includes questions related to recruitment of Russians into the French Foreign Legion; acceptance of Russians into French military schools; documentation of Russian military personnel in France; missing persons. Typescript and handwritten
Decorations and citations received by Russian troops from French government. Typescript
Ministerstvo Innostrannykh Del and other Russian diplomatic agencies, 1920-1923
Correspondence. Includes correspondence of Grigorii Aleksinskii, Nicholas de Basili, Mikhail Girs, Aleksandr Neratov and Petr Struve
General office. Includes administrative and financial matters. Typescript and handwritten
Individual cases. Includes requests for visas and other documents and inquiries re missing persons. Typescript and handwritten
Military matters. Includes telegrams and transcripts of telegrams re situation on the Crimean and Polish fronts. Typescript

Resettlement and supply of military and civilian refugees. Includes material re cadet schools; supply of hospitals on Gallipoli, Lemnos and in Yugoslavia; activity of Komitet po Delam o Bezhentsakh Severnoi Oblasti and Biuro Trudovoi Pomoshchi pri Rossiiskoi Missii v Afinakh. Typescript and handwritten

Transfer of military personnel to the Crimean front. Includes information re Far Eastern troops interned in China; situation of Russian troops in Estonia; repatriation of Russian military personnel by France and situation of Soviet prisoners of war in Germany. Also see individual cases, above. Typescript and handwritten
Reports re disposition of Soviet Army and political situation in Poland. Typescript
Finansovo-Kontrol'naia Komissiia pri Rossiiskom Posol'stve vo Frantsii, 1919-1923
General office correspondence re financial matters. Includes financing of Russian military agencies, military schools, hospitals and homes for invalid servicemen. Typescript and handwritten
Archive of Russkii Ekspeditsionnyi Korpus vo Frantsii. Miscellaneous material re its relocation. Typescript
Individual cases. Includes reimbursement of individuals for expenses and losses suffered while on military duty. Typescript and handwritten
Turkey. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Turtsii, 1920 July-1921 Sept.
General correspondence of central office with Russian representatives abroad. Includes material re maintenance of Russian administration in Turkey
France. Ministere de la Guerre and other military administrative bodies
Reports. Includes material re Communist Party in Russia and Turkish military activity in Anatolia. Includes maps
Telegrams, intelligence and information re military action and movement of troops in Crimea; creation of Polish Third Army. Includes telegrams from Sevastopol'
Politics. Political activity of emigre committees and groups
Press. Bulletins of "Biuro Russkoi Pechati v Konstantinopole"
Turkey. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Turtsii, 1921-1923
General. Includes diplomatic and military matters; evacuation and settlement of military refugees
Denmark. List of Russian military buried in Helsingfors
Gallipoli. Press re executions on Gallipoli
Germany. Includes material re Army of Gen. Bermondt and Russian prisoners of war
Imperial family, assassination. Includes letter of N. Sokolov
Poland. Includes material re Boris Savinkov, Gen. Petr Makhrov, the Russian Third Army and Tukhol' Internment Camp
Printed matter, Russkii Komitet v Turtsii. Materialy po voprosu ob evakuatsii russkikh bezhentsev iz Konstantinopolia
Reports, including on Belorussia, Turkey and Anatolia. Includes transcripts of Soviet radio. Typescript
General Headquarters of Lieut.-Gen. Baron Petr Vrangel' and Russian Military Representatives, 1919-1921
Administration. Includes instructions to Military Representatives
Military personnel. Includes material re transfer of officers to Crimea; missing persons
Poland. Includes correspondence of Gen. Petr Makhrov
Supplies, finances, communication and transportation. Includes material re navy and commercial fleet
Declaration of Baron Petr Vrangel' re his policies. Printed copy
Reports. Includes intelligence re conditions on military fronts, interviews with eyewitnesses from the Soviet Union; conditions of life for refugees. Typescript
General Headquarters of Lieut.-Gen. Baron Petr Vrangel' and Russian Military Representatives, 1921
Military personnel. Includes material re officers' associations
Poland. Includes correspondence of Gen. Petr Makhrov
Press. Includes press releases to Vladimir Burtsev and Pavel Miliukov
Relocation, repatriation and maintainance of Russian troops. Includes correspondence with French authorities
Russkii Sovet, K voprosu o Russkoi Armii
General Headquarters of Lieut.-Gen. Baron Petr Vrangel' and Russian Military Representatives, 1921-1922
Cossacks. Open letter of Ataman Petr Krasnov
Poland. Includes material re Tukhol' internment camp; correspondence of Gen. Petr Makhrov
Relocation and maintenance of Russian military, especially in the Balkans
Supply. Includes negotiations with French government re naval compensation
Reports. Includes material re conditions in and relations with the Soviet Union. Typescript
General Headquarters of Lieut.-Gen. Baron Petr Vrangel' and Russian Military Representatives, 1922-1923
Administration. Includes material re Lieut.-Gen. IUrii Romanovskii
Poland. Includes correspondence of Gen. Petr Makhrov
Russian Army abroad. Includes material re employment and living conditions; aid to refugees; situation in Bulgaria and France
Reports. Includes material re situation in Soviet Union; conditions for Russian Army abroad; execution of Metropolitan Veniamin of Petrograd. Typescript
General Headquarters of Lieut.-Gen. Baron Petr Vrangel' and Russian Military Representatives, 1923
Poland. Includes correspondence of Gen. Petr Makhrov
Reports. Includes essays by IUrii Artsybashev and Sergei Mel'gunov
General Headquarters of Lieut.-Gen. Baron Petr Vrangel' and Russian Military Representatives, 1924-1925
Correspondence. Includes Voennyi Agent vo Frantsii, Lieut.-Gen. Evgenii Miller and Nachal'nik Gruppy Russkoi Armii vo Frantsii i Bel'gii, Lieut.-Gen. Pavel SHatilov. Typescript and handwritten
Russian Army abroad. Includes reports re employment of military refugees, especially transfer from Bulgaria to France and Belgium; conditions of work in France

unittitle.title: Informatsionnyi Biulleten'

"Svodka o zhizni chastei gallipoliiskoi gruppy v Bolgarii"
General, including on administration; work projects; intelligence
Legal status of Russian officers in France
Red Cross. Includes rules for obtaining exit visas from Soviet Union
Russkii Soiuz Uvechennykh Voinov v Germanii
Soiuz Ob"edinennykh Ofitserskikh Obshchestv and Obshchestvo Russkikh Ofitserov Artilleristov (Czechoslovakia)
Soiuz Russkikh Ofitserov Uchastnikov Velikoi Voiny
Soiuz Russkikh Ofitserov v Korolevstve Vengerskom
Russian Army abroad. Military and civilian refugees, 1919-1922
Russkii Natsional'nyi Komitet and Russkii Sovet. Includes "Ocherki Politicheskoi ZHizni"
Soiuz Russkikh Ofitserov, Uchastnikov Velikoi Voiny and Obshchestvo Russkikh Ofitserov General'nago SHtaba
Refugees, especially military. Includes list of aid organizations in Paris; activity of aid and other organizations; employment; individual cases
Relations with French and international authorities
Saloniki Front (Macedonia). Conflict re disposal of military chaplain's supplies
Transfer of officers to Crimea and the Far East. Includes material re Rossiiskii Torgovyi Flot
Russian Army abroad. Military and civilian refugees, 1922-1924

Osobaia Komissiia po razsledovaniiu zlodeianii bol'shevikov, sostoiashchei pri Glavnokomanduiushchem Vooruzhennymi Silami na IUge Rossii, 1918-1919. See PHOTOGRAPHS
Sidorov, D. A., Organizovannye razstrely obshchestvennykh deiatelei v Moskovskoi Butyrskoi tiurme
Osobaia Komissiia po razsledovaniiu zlodeianii bol'shevikov, sostoiashchei pri Glavnokomanduiushchem Vooruzhennymi Silami na IUge Rossii, 1918-1919. Printed matter

unittitle.title: Akt razsledovaniia o nasil'stvennom zakhvate vlasti bol'shevikami (kommunistami) v Stavropol'skoi gubernii
Akt razsledovaniia o sotsializatsii devushek i zhenshchin v gor. Ekaterinodare po mandatam Sovetskoi vlasti
Akt razsledovaniia o zlodeianiiakh bol'shevikov, sovershennykh v 1918 i 1919 godakh v Sviatogorskom Uspenskom monastyre Iziumskago uezda, KHar'kovskoi gub.
Akt rzsledovaniia po delam o zlodeianiiakh bol'shevikov v 1919 godu v g. Novocherkasske i drugikh mestnostiakh Donskoi oblasti
Akt razledovaniia po delu o neudavshemsia napadenii bol'shevikov na poezd Frantsuzskoi missii...
Akt razsledovaniia po delu o vzryve bol'shevikami bomb na uchebnom sudne 'Rion ubiistvakh, sovershennykh bol'shevikami (kommunistami) v iiune-iiule 1918 g. v g. Stavropole (Kavkazskom)
Akt razsledovaniia po delu o zlodeianiiakh bol'shevikov v stanitsakh Labinskago Otdela i v gor. Armavire
Akt razsledovaniia po delu ob izbienii bol'shevikami v lazaretakh stanitsy Elizavetinskoi ranenykh i bol'nykh uchastnikov Dobrovol'cheskoi Armii
Akt razsledovaniia po delu ob ubiistvakh, sovershennykh bol'shevikami v 1918 godu v gorode Rostove na Donu
Izvlecheniia iz proizvodiashchagosia Osoboi Komissiei...razsledovaniia o bol'shevikakh v g. Poltave i Poltavskoi gubernii
Soobshchenie o goneniiakh bol'shevikov (kommunistov) na tserkov' v Donskoi oblasti
Spravka o sozhzhenii krasnoameitsami kazaka IAkova CHusa
Svedeniia o razgrome bol'shevikami Taganrogskago Okruzhnago Suda
Svedeniia o zlodeiianiiakh bol'shevikov na iuzhnom poberezh'e Kryma (gorod IAlta i eia okrestnosti)
Svedeniia o zlodeianiiakh bol'shevikov v gor. Evpatorii
Svedeniia ob arestakh, proizvodivshikhsia bol'shevikami v Stavropole Kavkazskom s 1 ianvaria po 8 iiulia 1918 g.
Vypiska iz akta po delu o zlodeianiiakh bol'shevikov v g. IAlte i eia okrestnostiakh (zlodeianiia protiv musul'manskago naseleniia)
Vypiska ob otnoshenii bol'shevikov k magometanskoi religii, iz dela ozlodeianiiakh bol'shevikov v Stavropol'skoi gubernii

did.unittitle: Belgium. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Bel'gii, Col. Andrei Prezhbiano, 1920-1921
Reports. Includes reports re Bolshevik activity in Europe

Germany. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Germanii, Col. Aleksei von Lampe, 1922-1923. Reports. Includes material re Russian officers' organizations; political situation in Germany and excerpts from German press
Hungary. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Vengrii, Lieut-Gen. Vladimir Marushevskii and Col. Aleksei von Lampe, 1920-1921
Correspondence. General. Includes material re Austria; French and international authorities

11 prints depicting Bolshevik atrocities. Evidence collected by the Osobaia Komissiia po razsledovaniiu zlodeianii bol'shevikov, sostoiashchei pri Glavnokomanduiushchem Vooruzhennymi Silami na IUge Rossii, 1918-1919. (File 42)
6 unidentified prints depicting aspects of the Russian Civil War, 1917-1921
1 portrait print depicting Col. A. Bitenbinder
1 portrait print depicting Lieut.-Gen. Anton Denikin
1 print depicting arrival of Lieut.-Gen. Aleksandr
7 prints depicting Lieut.-Gen. Vladimir Mai-Maevskii in KHar'kov and Poltava, 1919
1 portrait print depicting Maj.-Gen. P. Nepenin
1 portrait print depicting Vladimir Pedsovskii, Kuban
1 print depicting the grave of Vladimir Purishkevich
2 prints depicting the cathedral in Ekaterinodar
3 prints depicting Taganrog during the Civil War
7 prints depicting White Russian officers of "Polk imeni Gen. Alskseeva" in Decazeville, France
7 glass negatives depicting aspects of the Russian shelf Civil War in South Russia
